post_text: Lowndes High School will host its annual Salute to the Military Event on Friday, September 11, 2020, at Martin Stadium, on the campus of Lowndes High School, during our home game against Griffin. Gates will open at 6:30 and pre-game activities will begin at 7:30. All active duty and retired military personnel with ID will be admitted free of charge, on the visitor’s side of the stadium. This includes active duty or retired members, one guest, and their school-age children. If an active duty member is deployed, their spouse and children may enter with their ID. Superintendent Wes Taylor and Principal LeAnne McCall invite you to attend this special event as we salute our military and their families! #OneLowndes

Purposity is an App that allows our community to give anonymously to students in need. Purposity comes from the core belief that humanity finds purpose through generosity...Purposity. Everywhere around us we see people in need. We also see people who want to help others but don’t know how. Purposity connects those dots through the power of text messaging and social media.

So, here’s what we’re asking you to do. First, download the Purposity app AND follow Lowndes County Schools. Then, this is what we really need your help with... SHARE this information! GET THE WORD OUT to our community! We’ve got to let our generous, caring friends and neighbors know that this is a way to help our students. We’ve got to get this tool into the hands of those in our community who want to help out! #OneLowndes

Thanks so much for all you do, and thanks for your support in helping us make a difference...One Lowndes!

The theme for the 2020-21 school year at Hahira Middle School is RESILIENCE - the capacity to recover quickly from difficulties. Students, teachers, and staff read the short story "Sweet, difficult sounds" by I.M. Desta and learned how to handle difficult situations in the face of adversity. Connection teachers were able to connect the short story to being resilient. What makes a structure resilient? Mr. Johnson’s Engineering Technology classes competed in the Card Tower Challenge to find out! Computer Science students learned how computer programmers have to be resilient when debugging code for a program.
#OneLowndes

How to find your Child’s GTID
(Georgia Testing ID)

Login into Parent Portal with your username and password
•If you need assistance with Parent Portal, email portal@lowndes.k12.ga.us from the email address we have on file for you (parent).
1. On the “Homepage” click the menu bar (three horizontal lines) in the top left corner
2. Click on “More”
3. Then click on “GTID”
4. If you have multiple children, you can view all your children by clicking on the down arrow (Top right of screen beside your child’s name).

We miss and ❤️ all of our students!

Our hope would be tickets could go on sale at the end of June with a July deadline for renewal but until we have more answers season tickets will not be sold. #OneLowndes

Another great week of supporting our students!!!

We are proud to announce that we were able to provide 9,568
meals to Lowndes County students this week (April 20-24)! This would not have been possible without a team effort. Sending a huge thank you to our amazing School Nutrition Department and all of the teachers, administrators, and staff members who volunteered!

They will listen intently or jump in moving 90 mph. If there’s a crisis, they are going to be the first to show up and last to leave.
They truly want to support students, families and faculty. Lowndes County Schools has the best of the best! If one of these ladies shows up, don’t fret-feel blessed you have the privilege of their support! Sandra Flowers Wilcher, Sharon Tucker Bradshaw, Penny Strickland Turner, Sherri Shuman Willis, Natalie Anne, and Tan Jones
